formName: Tell HMRC your organisation failed to prevent the facilitation of tax evasion

sections.title: Is some or all of the evaded tax owed in the UK?

fields.label: Is some or all of the evaded tax owed in the UK?

sections.title: To use this service the evaded tax must have been owed in the UK

fields.infoText:
You can only use this service to report a failure to prevent the facilitation of UK tax evasion. 

Failure to prevent the facilitation of foreign tax evasion should be reported to the [Serious Fraud Office](https://www.sfo.gov.uk/).

You will need to sign out of this service.

sections.title: Are you authorised by the company to make this report on its behalf?

fields.label: Are you authorised by the company to make this report on its behalf?

sections.title: To use this service you must be authorised by the company

fields.infoText:
You can only use this service to self-report on behalf of a company if the company has authorised you to do so. 

To report another company, or an individual taxpayer, contact the [HMRC fraud hotline](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/contact/customs-excise-and-vat-fraud-reporting).

You will need to sign out of this service.

sections.title: Tell us how the criminal facilitation of tax evasion took place

fields.infoText:
Summarise how the tax evasion was facilitated.  

Include any details you have about:

* who within the organisation facilitated the evasion
* the capacity in which they were acting
* how they facilitated the evasion
* who they helped to evade tax 
* what tax was evaded
* how it was discovered

fields.label: When is the facilitation of tax evasion a criminal act?
fields.infoText: For the facilitation of tax evasion to be a criminal act, a person must have deliberately and dishonestly helped another person to evade tax. This doesn’t include the accidental, ignorant or negligent facilitation of tax evasion.

sections.title: Give your report a submission reference

fields.helpText: Create a unique submission reference for your report. Use 12 characters, including numbers and upper-case letters. For example, 3H2M94VZ1FS4

fields.infoText: If you or the company have previously made a report to HMRC, make sure you do not enter a submission reference that has already been used.
Make a note of your submission reference. HMRC will use this during any further correspondence with you.

sections.title: Give consent to how HMRC will use your information

fields.infoText:
I understand and agree to the following: 

* the personal data collected from this report will be processed in accordance with data protection law, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018
* HMRC will collect, use and share information submitted in this report in accordance with our  [Privacy Notice](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/data-protection-act-dpa-information-hm-revenue-and-customs-hold-about-you/data-protection-act-dpa-information-hm-revenue-and-customs-hold-about-you)

* if the information submitted leads to an investigation, HMRC may share your contact details with other relevant third parties, where necessary

* HMRC may use evidence from this report in a prosecution or other court proceedings, where permitted by law

choices: I confirm that I understand and agree
I understand and agree that I may commit a criminal offence if I give false information or include information that I don’t honestly believe to be true in this report.
